definition[0]: someone who believes in a particular system of ideas, or who supports a leader who teaches these ideas
example[0]: Marx and his followers were convinced that capitalism would destroy itself.
example[1]: followers of Sun Myung Moon, better known as Moonies
definition[1]: someone who looks at the messages sent by a particular person using the social networking service Twitter
example[2]: He currently has over 5000 followers on Twitter.
definition[2]: a company or product which is not one of the main ones in a particular market and does not have a large share of the market
example[3]: They returned to the business last fall with three laptop computers, but those machines were market followers.
definition[3]: a company or product which is technically less advanced than others
example[4]: It will take this competitor, a traditional follower behind the major brands, some time to come up with anything as good.
